versions.localizedDescription:
# 15.0.0

## Highlights

- **YouTube Music**: New provider (select in Server type). Search and stream without login. Home shows Harmony-style layout with Quick picks, Popular playlists, Trending; search shows Artists, Playlists, Songs.
- **General options** (Settings > General): Toggles for Lyrics, Downloads, Volume on player bar, Queue button, Shuffle & repeat (desktop). YouTube Music can be re-enabled on Windows/Linux (off by default on desktop).
- **Onboarding**: Language -> Theme (System/Light/Dark/OLED) -> Accent colour -> Get Started. Localized (English, ‰∏≠Êñá, –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π). When not logged in: welcome message and no-server screen after Get Started.
- **Multi-server**: Add, edit, remove, switch saved servers without reload. Settings > Server lists saved servers; legacy single-server prefs migrate on first load.
- **Detail headers**: Gradient derived from cover image (dominant color, darkened). Fades in over 280ms; no flicker. Shuffle/Play are circular icon-only; Shuffle in horizontal scroll on narrow panels.
- **Artist/album/playlist**: Clickable artist names (no underline) open artist page when in library. Albums/Songs tab is animated segmented control (purple pill, 220ms). Tab bar full width, equal segments.
- **Now playing**: Single responsive screen (mobile & desktop, breakpoint 900px). Compact: carousel, progress, controls, queue/favorite/lyrics/more. Expanded: album + controls left, Up Next / Lyrics right. Download in more-options: start, cancel, or delete download. Volume control. Close button clears queue and stops playback.
- **Now playing polish (release pass)**:
  - Desktop uses blurred artwork background and improved spacing for smaller heights.
  - Play/pause visual treatment unified (no gradient orb styling).
  - Volume controls support keyboard shortcuts and toggle-style panels.
  - Queue and lyrics panels now hide/show contextually based on availability.
- **YouTube Music follow-based home**:
  - Home supports followed content and guidance when library is empty.
  - Follow actions for artist/album/playlist with per-server persistence.
  - Mix-style playlists are excluded from follow surfaces.
- **Search**: Full-width bar. Shows albums, artists, songs for all providers; YouTube Music also shows community playlists. Server URL validation rejects YouTube Music with clear message.
- **Dates**: Year/month/day (e.g. 2025/02/21) for album Added, Settings build date, log names.

## Design & UI

- **Organic refined** look: AppTokens (Plus Jakarta Sans + Nunito, teal accent, warm dark palette, soft radii). Same tokens on desktop and mobile; light, dark, OLED.
- **OLED**: Pure black (#000000) everywhere when OLED theme selected. Dark mode uses charcoal (#1C1C1E).
- **Gemini-style**: Dark palette (#0a0a0c page, #0e0e11 sidebar, etc.). Sidebar: purple logo box, rounded nav tiles, Library label, Settings at bottom. Settings sidebar: section headers, rounded cards, status (e.g. Connected).
- **Dialogs**: Apple-style frosted glass (blur, rounded corners, scale/fade). showAppDialog / showAppConfirmDialog / showAppChoiceDialog (Apple* deprecated). Select Language, Theme, accent/custom color redesigned.
- **Mobile**: extendBody so content under nav/player bars; bars use frosted glass. Bottom padding so content not covered by nav bar.
- **Empty states**: Full-width centered icon and text. Home: no header; content starts with quick access and sections.
- **Settings**: iOS-style grouped list (Server, Playback, Appearance, About), sub-pages. Connection shows Jellyfin username (User.Name) or "Logged in". Connection box adapts by provider (Local, YouTube Music, Jellyfin/Plex/Subsonic).
- **Queue/lyrics overlays**:
  - Current track is pinned at the top of queue presentations.
  - Lyrics open at the current playback position.
  - Lyrics tabs/buttons are hidden when lyrics are unavailable.

## Fixes

- **Queue**: Clear queue also clears current track and emits null so player bar hides.
- **Layout**: Mobile nav no longer overflows on resize (Expanded + FittedBox). KeyedSubtree on breakpoint switch avoids _elements.contains assertion.
- **Dialogs**: showAppleDialog (and Add/Edit server) use actionsBuilder so Navigator.pop uses dialog context-fixes "Looking up a deactivated widget's ancestor" when caller screen already closed.
- **Search**: Bar no longer Expanded inside PageTemplate (layout crash); use fixed width (320px).
- **Server settings**: Subsonic/Navidrome config data shown via displayServerUrl and displayUsername on login/restore.
- **Now playing**: Album/artist lines under title have no underline. Lyrics: no yellow underline (TextDecoration.none).
- **Now playing**: Volume overlay no longer blocks slider drag; tapping outside closes the overlay.
- **Now playing**: Added mobile parity for The Mind Electric easter egg behavior.
- **Settings**: Reliable scrolling (AlwaysScrollableScrollPhysics, ConstrainedBox). Add/switch server no longer kicks you off Settings (shell keeps selection).

## Removed

- Android Auto, voice commands (Google Assistant, deep links, MEDIA_PLAY_FROM_SEARCH, shortcuts).
- Dynamic Isle / mini player island. Standalone Local Music screen (config in Settings only).
- Refresh buttons (Library, Albums, Artists, Playlists, Tracks, detail, Rescan). Login screen (main shell always; Connect/Disconnect in Settings).
- Unused: cached_image.dart, apple_design/glassmorphism.dart. General settings section (OLED/Show album art moved to Theme dialog). Mobile-only UI.

## Linux

- YouTube Music disabled in Server type and saved list by default; if current server was YT Music on startup, app switches or disconnects.
- YouTube Music playback: media_kit (mpv), setlocale(LC_NUMERIC, "C") before mpv to avoid "Non-C locale" crash. Fallback: ~/.config/mpv/mpv.conf with ao=pulse,pipewire,alsa. Packaged .desktop uses LC_ALL=C.
- Other Linux playback: audioplayers (GStreamer). Install gstreamer, gst-plugins-base, gst-plugins-good, gst-libav.

## Refactors & performance

- **Single codebase**: One set of Dart UI for mobile and desktop; sidebar >=768px, bottom nav on mobile. No ui/desktop vs ui/mobile split. Navigation in lib/services; theme in lib/ui/theme.
- **Dialog API**: showAppDialog, showAppConfirmDialog, showAppChoiceDialog, AppDialogOption. Theme/layout in app_tokens.dart, desktop_theme.dart.
- **Startup**: System info logging after first frame. Isolates for dominant color, cache/API JSON (Jellyfin, local). List keys, lazy tab loading, Selector for playlists/artists/albums. Now playing: AnimatedBuilder for skip/snap-back (no setState per tick); blur limited to header.
- **YouTube Music**: Prefer 96-160 kbps stream; position-based completion fallback on mobile for auto-play/next.
- **Lint**: mounted checks after async (media_details, settings_page); braces in now_playing lyrics.
- **Cleanup**: Add-to-playlist consolidated (Create New Playlist in DesktopLayout; used from now-playing and home). ArtistDetailScreen vs ArtistDetailsPage clarified. Page template title: TextDecoration.none.

# 14.0.0

- New UI for both desktop and mobile.
- Don't show desktop sidebar when on small screens.
- Remove logging.
- Expand the about Doudou section.
- Port the old navbar.
- Settings scales.
- New app layouts.
- Port the now playing screen.
- Spec bump to 14.0.0.
- Mobile track now goes left from right.
- Lyrics icon is now a microphone; only shown when lyrics are available.
- Fixed animation when reversing a song.

# 12.0.1

- Updated donate URL | https://openlyst.ink/support
- Version bump to 12.0.1
- Haptic feedback for favorite button

apps.name: Docan
apps.subtitle: AI chat app with Liquid Glass UI
apps.localizedDescription: Docan is a cross-platform AI chat app. Connect multiple providers and keep conversations in one interface across desktop, mobile, and web.

versions.localizedDescription:
# 3.0.0

## New Features

### AI Providers
- Added DeepSeek AI support with `deepseek-chat` and `deepseek-reasoner` models.
- Added LM Studio support with OpenAI-compatible API.
- Dynamic model fetching from API.

### Image Creator
- Added dedicated Image Creator screen for generating images with AI.
- Supports Gemini and OpenAI DALL-E providers.

### Playbooks
- Added Playbooks: User-created YAML integrations for extending Docan.
- Create custom API integrations with a simple YAML SDK.

### Attachments & Drag-and-Drop
- Added support for attachments in chat.
- Drag and drop files directly onto the app.

apps.name: Finar
apps.subtitle: Jellyfin frontend client
apps.localizedDescription: Finar is a cross-platform Jellyfin client built with Flutter. It includes native playback with media_kit, offline support with Hive, and an adaptive interface for desktop, mobile, and TV.

versions.localizedDescription:
# 3.0.0

# Added
- Who's watching? screen for multiple Jellyfin accounts (Netflix-style profile picker)
- Multiple accounts: save and switch between several server/user profiles
- Add profile and Manage profiles flows; sign out removes current profile from device
- Watchlist row on home (desktop and mobile); home data includes watchlist, invalidated when toggling from detail
- Sleep timer: Settings > Playback (Off, 15/30/45/60 min, End of current); player overlay shows remaining time and Cancel
- Theme and appearance: Settings > Appearance ‚Äî Theme (System / Light / Dark), Use system accent, Accent color (Teal, Purple, Blue, Pink, Orange)

# Changed
- Unified UI: removed separate desktop/ and mobile/ page folders; single responsive pages (home, settings, detail, player, library, music_library, downloads) with sidebar on wide screens and bottom nav/single column on narrow
- Library page (mobile): list-style cards with icon, type label, and item count instead of large gradient grid
- Upgraded dependencies: dio, riverpod, flutter_riverpod, intl, package_info_plus, share_plus, gamepads; Riverpod 3 migration with legacy imports; share_plus 12 SharePlus API; AsyncValue.when for null fallbacks
- App startup: with 2+ saved profiles, Who's watching is shown instead of auto-restoring; with 1 profile, behavior unchanged
- Sidebar and Settings: Switch profile opens Who's watching; Sign out removes current profile (with confirmation)

# Fixed
- Theme and accent: theme mode (System/Light/Dark) and accent color now apply across the app; settings load before first frame so stored theme is used on launch; "Use system accent" is persisted via setUseSystemAccent
- Detail more-options sheet: Download, Share, and Media Info now work; Add to Playlist / Report Issue show "Coming soon"
- Home media card Add button adds/removes item from watchlist with SnackBar feedback
- Music library track row: favorite button toggles favorite and refreshes list
- Music player bar: Shuffle shuffles playlist and plays from start; Repeat cycles off ‚Üí one ‚Üí all; More shows "Coming soon" SnackBar
- Queue "Now Playing" tap triggers play/pause; library sort button no longer appears disabled
- Who's watching: show current session as a profile when saved list was empty (recovery); avoid row overflow with horizontal scroll or wrap
- Login page: hide scrollbar on form scrollables; fix contrast (solid dark form card so white text is readable); Quick Connect tip uses textSecondary for readability

# 2.0.0

- Version bump to 2.0.0.
- Header now shows TV show name and episode.
- Desktop search bar now spans the full width.
- Removed the extra season picker for TV shows.
- Opening an episode now takes you to the show page with that season expanded.
- 'See All' buttons now work.
- On-screen controls appear when you move the mouse.
- On-screen controls auto-hide after a short delay.
- Fixed card clipping.
- Fixed desktop detail clipping/overflow by letting action controls wrap on smaller widths.
- Fixed desktop detail action bar overflow on narrow widths by using a single-row horizontal action strip.
- Resizing between desktop and mobile layouts now keeps page context (detail/player/library/downloads/settings).
- Updated the desktop Details panel to use liquid glass styling.
- Desktop sidebar profile card now hides the server URL and shows a user avatar (with initials fallback).
- Focus/hover outlines on media cards now adapt to artwork colors instead of a fixed accent.
- Updated the desktop Trailer button to match the liquid-glass style used by other controls.
- Trailer playback flow now works end-to-end: local trailers play in-app, and remote trailers open through URL launcher with URL normalization.

# 1.1.0

## Fixed
- Fixed controller input in SteamOS

versions.localizedDescription:
# 8.0.0

- README: expanded with features, prerequisites, getting started, and build instructions
- Settings Account: visual refresh; Accounts section with description and filled Add button
- Settings Account (mobile): fix semantics assertion (parentDataDirty) by giving embedded account list bounded height
- OLED theme: use pure black for all backgrounds and bar
- Android: opt out of edge-to-edge so status bar can be hidden on Android 15+
- Fix black-on-black text in Settings Account, Feeds, Profile, Favorites, and Blacklist empty states
- Android: hide system status bar for a cleaner full-screen look
- Settings (Android): system back button returns to main settings list from sub-pages
- Post detail: show instantly when opened from list using already-loaded post data
- Feeds: multi-host support; feed list global (same for all accounts)
- Post detail: preload comments; comments sheet shows them immediately and lazy-loads more on scroll
- Post detail: vote buttons and score/comment indicators use thumbs up / thumbs down icons
- Post grid: cache dimensions from post preview aspect ratio; wrap each cell in AspectRatio
- Performance: offload API JSON parsing to background isolate; storage JSON decode moved to background isolate
- macOS: minimum deployment target raised to 11.0
- Post detail: tag chips coloured by tag category; preload preview and full image for adjacent posts
- I-finished milk animation and Gallery button for finished posts in Settings Behavior
- App starts in guest mode; login page only when user chooses to log in
- Mobile nav bar: default Home, Search, Profile, Settings; More menu opens Hot, Popular, Favorites, Feeds
- Profile: three tabs (Main, Uploads, Favorites) with pill-style tab bar
- Search history and feeds per-account
- Feeds: Both type (image + video); And tags and Or tags
- Settings: Back button when opened as route; reorder categories; Feeds in desktop sidebar
- Account options: Test connection; Account management in Settings > Account only
- Optional I-finished button (default off) with milk-style animation and optional camera photo
- Feeds: e621 file-type metatags for image/video; create image or video feeds with include/exclude tags
- Post detail: View profile opens in-app profile; resolve uploader username by ID; uploader profile card
- OLED theme: pure black across shell, nav bar, sidebar, settings, search, profile, login, post cards
- Profile page redesign: hero card with avatar, stats grid, account info, styled action buttons
- Settings Account: avatar glow and border from profile image; show user profile picture when available
- Post detail: tapping a tag navigates to search tab; e621-style DText in descriptions and comments
- Download: Android/iOS save to photo gallery; desktop save to Downloads/openlyst/klit with Open folder
- Complete UI redo: responsive UI layer with layout scope, shell, widgets, pages; desktop sidebar, mobile bottom nav
- New unified UI system (single codebase for desktop and mobile); major performance optimizations
- New navbar engine; stateless

# 7.0.0

- Updates version to **7.0.0**.
- Updated description to "E926 API client"

## Added

### üîÑ Pull-to-Refresh on Mobile Home Page
- Added native pull-down-to-refresh support on the mobile Home page
- Swipe down from the top of the post grid to refresh latest posts
- Smooth refresh indicator animation with haptic feedback

### ‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Controls for Mobile Post Viewer
Added keyboard navigation support to the mobile post detail viewer, matching the desktop experience:

**Navigation:**
- `A` / `‚Üê` ‚Äî Previous post
- `D` / `‚Üí` ‚Äî Next post

**Actions:**
- `F` ‚Äî Toggle favorite
- `W` / `‚Üë` ‚Äî Upvote (toggle)
- `S` / `‚Üì` ‚Äî Downvote (toggle)

### üì± Material Style Navigation Bar
- Added a proper Material-style bottom navigation bar when Material UI mode is enabled
- Full-width design with simple icon/label layout (no floating pill style)
- Clean top border separator instead of shadow/blur effects
- Consistent with Android Material Design guidelines

### ‚öôÔ∏è Material Style Settings Page
- Settings page now responds to UI style mode
- Material mode uses solid containers without blur effects
- Clean borders and simple dividers in Material mode
- Removes glass effects and shadows for better performance on lower-end devices

### üåà Rating Aura on Post Cards
- Posts now display a colored glow/aura around the card based on content rating
- **Green** ‚Äî Safe content
- **Orange** ‚Äî Questionable content
- **Red** ‚Äî Explicit content
- Removed the text badge from the bottom-left corner for a cleaner look
- Rating is now instantly visible at a glance without reading text
- **Liquid Glass mode**: Enhanced glass-like aura with layered glows, soft outer bloom, and subtle highlight reflection
- **Material mode**: Simple, performance-focused aura effect

### üìê Centralized Post Grid Settings
- New **POST GRID** section in Settings with comprehensive controls:
  - **Auto Mode** ‚Äî Automatically adjusts grid columns based on screen width (2 cols for phones, 3 for tablets, up to 8 for large monitors)
  - **Grid Size** ‚Äî Manual control for number of columns (disabled when Auto Mode is on)
  - **Spacing** ‚Äî Slider to control gap between post cards (0-16pt)
  - **Padding** ‚Äî Slider to control outer padding around the grid (0-24pt)
  - **Score Threshold** ‚Äî Configurable minimum score filter for latest posts (0-100, default: 20). Posts automatically reload when changed.
- Added same POST GRID settings to desktop settings page (Content section)
- Removed per-page grid size controls from Home, Hot, Popular, Favorites, and Search pages
- Removed grid size selectors from desktop toolbar (Home, Hot, Popular, Favorites, Search)
- All pages now use centralized settings for consistent appearance

### üö´ Blacklist Management
- New **BLACKLIST** section in Settings (mobile and desktop):
  - **Enable Blacklist** ‚Äî Toggle to enable/disable blacklist filtering globally
  - **Manage Blacklist** ‚Äî Opens dedicated page to edit blacklist rules
- **Blacklist Settings Page** with full management:
  - **Sync from Account** ‚Äî Pull blacklisted tags from your e621/e926 account
  - **Text Editor** ‚Äî Edit blacklist entries directly (one tag/rule per line)
  - **Help Dialog** ‚Äî Documents blacklist syntax (AND logic, rating filters, wildcards, metatags)
  - Shows active rule count and enabled status
- All pages automatically filter posts based on blacklist rules

## Fixed

### üéä Left-Handed Mode Confetti Position
- Fixed confetti animation playing from the wrong side when left-handed mode is enabled
- Confetti now correctly originates near the favorite button position in both left and right-handed modes

### üìê Auto Mode Grid Scaling
- Fixed auto mode only using up to 4 columns even on large screens
- Auto mode now scales properly: 2 cols (phones) ‚Üí 3 (tablets) ‚Üí 4-5 (small desktops) ‚Üí 6-8 (large monitors)
- Grid now properly responds to window resizing using LayoutBuilder

### üîç Tag Suggestions Overhaul
- **Fixed `-tag` and `~tag` prefix handling**: Tag suggestions now properly work when typing exclusion tags (e.g., `-scat`, `-young`) or optional tags (`~tag`)
- **Fixed suggestions closing unexpectedly**: Removed aggressive focus-based closing that caused suggestions to disappear while typing
- **Fixed suggestions appearing when not wanted**: Suggestions now only appear when actively typing a tag (2+ characters)
- **Tap outside to close**: Suggestions close when tapping anywhere outside the suggestion list
- **Better word detection**: Properly extracts the current word being typed, handling cursor position correctly
- **Prefix preservation**: When selecting a suggestion for `-tag` or `~tag`, the prefix is correctly preserved

### üñºÔ∏è Full Resolution Image Loading
- Fixed mobile post viewer not loading full resolution images
- Mobile now uses the same resolution priority as desktop: full file ‚Üí sample ‚Üí preview
- Fixes issues with small images (e.g., 512x512) not displaying at full quality on alternative servers

apps.name: Opentorrent
apps.subtitle: qBittorrent client
apps.localizedDescription: Opentorrent is a cross-platform qBittorrent client for iOS, macOS, Windows, Linux, Android, and web.

versions.localizedDescription:
# 2.0.0

- fixed sub-buttons on ios theme
- fixed navbar white coloured on ios
- better iso support
- new ios theme
- System option for design system
- Change your login from the login screen
- start on v2
- Torznab search category label: show "Adult" instead of placeholder "XXX"
- Add torrent page: scrollable layout so options and button do not overflow on small screens
- Torrent detail: localized tab labels and loading/error/not-found messages
- Login page: localized connection messages and default server name
- Settings and server preferences: localized update-check messages and preferences saved / not connected
- Torrent list: localized Select All tooltip, selected count, and delete confirmation
- Adaptive navigation: use CupertinoPageRoute when design system is Cupertino (torrent list, settings, server selection)
- Torrent list: Cupertino-style scaffold and nav bar when design system is Cupertino
- Add torrent: Cupertino scaffold with segmented control when design system is Cupertino
- Torrent detail: Cupertino scaffold with segmented control for tabs when design system is Cupertino
- Desktop: minimize/close to system tray using window_manager and tray_manager
- Desktop: global download/upload speed shown in sidebar (Material and Cupertino layouts)
- Torrent list: fix "No Material widget found" for FilterChip when using Cupertino design (wrap filter bar in Material)
- Fix Formatters usage: use formatDownloadSpeed/formatUploadSpeed instead of formatSpeedDown/formatSpeedUp
Initial release of Opentorrent, a cross-platform qBittorrent client that brings seamless torrenting to iOS, macOS, Windows, Linux, Android, and the Web.
